text: Bridget Rowe (16 March 1950 â€“ 12 January 2021) was a British journalist. Rowe was an Assistant Editor of The Sun, then editor of "Sunday", the News of the World's magazine. In 1986, Rowe became editor of Woman's Own.Hugh Thompson, "Dallasty and Glynis recipe", The Guardian, 7 July 1986 Rowe edited the Sunday Mirror from 1991 to 1992, then moved to edit The People."Inside Story: The ex- editors' files", The Independent, 9 May 2005 She was a panelist on the first series of Loose Women in 1999. Rowe died on 12 January 2021 from COVID-19 at the age of 70.Trailblazing journalist and Fleet Street legend Bridget Rowe dies aged 70 ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2021 deaths Category:British journalists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom
title: Bridget Rowe
